symbols.name: sap.sac.df
symbols.description: Dragonfly Library. Provides models and control to access Multidimensional Data via InA protocol and Firefly library

symbols.name: sap.sac.df.changeHandler.MultiDimModelChangeHandler
symbols.description: Control to handle changes of {@link sap.sac.df.model.MultiDimModel }. To store the changes in {@link sap.ui.fl.variants.VariantManagement} you need to include this change handler control as a dependent somewhere in the view tree for which the variant management is responsible. Each time new data is fetched and the event dataLoaded is fired a new change will be created. The method dataLoaded needs to be called once to register the {@link sap.sac.df.model.MultiDimModel} to the change handler.

parameters.name: sId
parameters.description: ID for the new control, generated automatically if no ID is given

methods.name: extend

parameters.name: sClassName
parameters.description: Name of the class being created

parameters.name: oClassInfo
parameters.description: Object literal with information about the class

parameters.name: FNMetaImpl
parameters.description: Constructor function for the metadata object; if not given, it defaults to the metadata implementation used by this class

methods.description: Creates a new subclass of class sap.sac.df.changeHandler.MultiDimModelChangeHandler with name sClassName and enriches it with the information contained in oClassInfo. oClassInfo might contain the same kind of information as described in {@link sap.ui.mdc.Control.extend}.

methods.name: getMetadata
methods.description: Returns a metadata object for class sap.sac.df.changeHandler.MultiDimModelChangeHandler.

methods.name: registerMultiDimModel
methods.description: Register {@link sap.sac.df.model.MultiDimModel} for handling changes

methods.name: skipApplyModelChangeOnce
methods.description: Skip the triggering of the event apply once

symbols.name: sap.sac.df.Grid
symbols.description: Grid A grid control for displaying multi-dimensional data

properties.name: metaPath
properties.description: Defines the relative path to the data provider in the multidimensional model.

constructor.description: Constructor for a new Grid control. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

methods.name: attachOnCellClick

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: oData
parameters.description: An application-specific payload object that will be passed to the event handler along with the event object when firing the event

parameters.name: fnFunction
parameters.description: The function to be called when the event occurs

parameters.name: oListener
parameters.description: Context object to call the event handler with. Defaults to this sap.sac.df.Grid itself

methods.description: Attaches event handler fnFunction to the {@link #event:onCellClick onCellClick} event of this sap.sac.df.Grid. When called, the context of the event handler (its this) will be bound to oListener if specified, otherwise it will be bound to this sap.sac.df.Grid itself. Fires on cell click event

methods.name: detachOnCellClick

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: fnFunction
parameters.description: The function to be called, when the event occurs

parameters.name: oListener
parameters.description: Context object on which the given function had to be called

methods.description: Detaches event handler fnFunction from the {@link #event:onCellClick onCellClick} event of this sap.sac.df.Grid. The passed function and listener object must match the ones used for event registration.

symbols.name: sap.sac.df.model.DataProvider
symbols.description:
A data provider is an analytical query exposed via an analytical engine and accessed via InA protocol. It represents a navigable query manager and allows to access and change data. Instances of this class should only be created by the {@link sap.sac.df.model.MultiDimModel}. Structure of Exposed Data: 

"Name": "",
"DataSourceInfo": { },
"Variables": { }
"Dimensions": { },
"Measures": [ ],
"Messages": [ ]
"AutoFetchEnabled": ""

properties.name: AutoFetchEnabled
properties.description: Indicator if the result set should be fetched automatically. The default value is true.

events.name: dataUpdated
events.description: The dataUpdated event is fired, when a new result set was fetched

events.name: visualizationAdded
events.description: The visualizationAdded event is fired, when a new visualization is added

events.name: visualizationRemoved
events.description: The visualizationRemoved event is fired, when a new visualization is removed

methods.name: addVisualization

parameters.name: sName
parameters.description: visualization name

parameters.name: sType
parameters.description: type of visualization

methods.description: Add new visualization

methods.name: applyMeasureConditions

parameters.name: aConditions
parameters.description: array of conditions

methods.description: Apply an array of conditions. If a condition in the list already exists, it will be removed and the provided condition will be applied.

methods.name: createMeasureCondition

parameters.name: sNewCondtionName
parameters.description: Unique name for condition

parameters.name: sMeasureStructureMember
parameters.description: Measure structure member to apply the condition to

parameters.name: oEvaluationType
parameters.description: Condtion evaluation type

parameters.name: aConditionThresholds
parameters.description: Comparison operator

parameters.name: sStructureMember
parameters.description: If a second structure exists, a second strcuture member must be specified. If it does not, it should be undefined.

methods.description: Create a condition which can be applied to the data provider.

methods.name: createScenario

returnValue.description: Promise with reference to created scenario

parameters.name: sScenarioId
parameters.description: scenario

methods.description: Execute scenario on data provider

methods.name: deserialize

returnValue.description: Promise with reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: oModelState
parameters.description: the JSON object containing the persisted state of a data provider to be applied.

parameters.name: sFormat
parameters.description: Format of the serialization (INA_REPOSITORY_DELTA or INA_REPOSITORY).

parameters.name: bSuppressUpdate
parameters.description: Indicator if the data provider updated should be suppressed after deserialization

methods.description: Updates the multidimensional model from the given the state of a data provider

methods.name: exportData

parameters.name: oDataExportConfig
parameters.description: Data export configuration

methods.description: Export Data

parameters.name: sClassName

symbols.name: sap.sac.df.model.MultiDimModel
symbols.description:
The multidimensional model allows to access and change data accessed via the InA Protocol. The multidimensional model populate it's exposed data in JSON format via binding to controls. Structure of Exposed Data: 

"DataProviders": { },
"VariableGroups": { },
"Messages": [ ]

parameters.name: sId
parameters.description: ID for the new control, generated automatically if no ID is given

parameters.name: mSettings
parameters.description: Initial settings for the new control.

constructor.description: Constructor for a new MultiDimModel. After model creation you need to wait for the event {@link #event:loaded loaded}.

examples.caption: how to add and configure a MultiDimModel via manifest.json

events.name: dataLoaded

parameters.name: dataProviderName
parameters.description: name of the data provider which data was loaded

events.description: The dataLoaded event is fired, when new data was loaded.

events.name: dataProviderAdded

parameters.name: dataProviderName
parameters.description: name of the added data provider

events.description: The dataProviderAdded event is fired, when a data provided is added to the model.

events.name: dataProviderRemoved

parameters.name: dataProviderName
parameters.description: name of the removed data provider

events.description: The dataProviderRemoved event is fired, when a data provider is removed from the model.

events.name: dataProviderUpdated

parameters.name: dataProviderName
parameters.description: name of the updated data provider

events.description: The dataProviderUpdated event is fired, when a data provider is updated.

events.name: loaded
events.description: The loaded event is fired, when the model finally constructed.

events.name: variableGroupsAdded
events.description: The variableGroupsAdded event is fired, when new variables groups are added.

methods.name: addDataProvider

returnValue.description: Promise which resolves the created data provider

parameters.name: sDataProviderName
parameters.description: Data provider name

parameters.description: Datasource name which the data provider is supposed to expose

parameters.name: sSystem
parameters.description: System name

parameters.name: sPackage
parameters.description: Package name

parameters.name: sSchema
parameters.description: Schema name

parameters.name: sDataSourceType
parameters.description: Data source type

parameters.name: bAutoFetchEnabled
parameters.description: if the data should be fetched automatically

methods.description: Creates a new data provider and attaches it to the model.

methods.name: createVariableGroup

parameters.name: sVariableGroupName
parameters.description: Variable group name

parameters.name: fnRule
parameters.description: Rule is a function which accept the variable definition and decides if the variable has to be part of te group.

parameters.name: oProperties
parameters.description: Additional properties

methods.description: Creates a new variable group and attaches it to the model. A variable group defines which variables of the underlying data providers should behave as the same variable. The group is defined by a name and a rule. The first added variable becomes automatically the MergedVariable.

returnValue.description: Promise with reference to this in order to allow method chaining
